casebody.data:
ATTORNEY GRIEVANCE COMMISSION OF MARYLAND
v.
Claire L.K.K. OGILVIE Misc. Docket AG No. 4, Sept. Term, 2016 Court of Appeals of Maryland. March 6, 2018 Argued by Lydia E. Lawless, Esquire, Bar Counsel (Kelsey Blown, Asst. Bar Counsel, Atty. Grievance Commission of Maryland), for Petitioner No argument on behalf of Respondent Argued Before: Barbera, C.J., Greene, Adkins, McDonald, Watts, Hotten, Getty, JJ. PER CURIAM ORDER

For reasons to be stated in an opinion later to be filed, it is this 6th day of March 2018,

ORDERED, by the Court of Appeals of Maryland, that the Respondent, Claire L.K.K. Ogilvie be, and she is hereby, disbarred, effective immediately, from the further practice of law in the State of Maryland; and it is further

ORDERED that the Clerk of this Court shall strike the name of Claire L.K.K. Ogilvie from the register of attorneys, and pursuant to Maryland Rule 19-761, shall certify that fact to the Trustees of the Client Protection Fund and the clerks of all judicial tribunals in the State; and it is further

ORDERED that Respondent shall pay all costs as taxed by the Clerk of this Court, including the costs of all transcripts, pursuant to Maryland Rule 19-709, for which sum judgment is entered in favor of the Attorney Grievance Commission of Maryland against Claire L.K.K. Ogilvie.
